summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, dated November 20, 2021. It announces the production of additional witness materials, including Jencks Act and Giglio material for potential trial witnesses, as well as certain materials relating to individuals the government does not currently intend to call. The letter emphasizes the materials are subject to a protective order.

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act, Giglio, and other witness-related materials to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the confidentiality of materials like those produced in this letter.

locations: 33 West 19th Street-4th Fl., New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The government was producing Jencks Act and Giglio material regarding potential trial witnesses in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.
The government was also producing materials related to individuals it did NOT currently intend to call as witnesses, which included certain witness statements.
All produced materials were governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, and marked as confidential.

The Department of Justice had directed the office to cease using the word 'confidential' on such materials to avoid confusion with classified documents, so a specific label referencing protective order paragraphs was used instead.
The government reserved the right to call individuals listed in the production for non-witnesses at a later date.
